record.DocumentTitle: August Report On Administration Of Internal Discipline attached with note from Deputy Chief Cronkhite Commander L. Binkley
record.Description: Report describes various officers conduct on and off duty such as crashing police vehicles and driving a vehicle off-duty intoxicated and the fines and penalties that occured due to the officers conduct if guilty. Some accounts were proved sustained and not sustained.

record.DocumentTitle: July Report On Administration Of Internal Discipline
record.Description: Report describes various officers conduct on and off duty such as falling sleep while on duty in police vehicle, improperly released a known prostitute, absented himself from duty without supervisors approval,consuming liquor while on duty and committed off-duty burglaries and the fines and penalties that occured due to the officers conduct if guilty. Some accounts were proved sustained and not sustained.

record.DocumentTitle: June Report On Administration of Internal Discipline
record.Description: Report describes various officers conduct on and off duty such as unnesessarily becoming involved with a prostitute and using his position with LAPD to get a free room at a motel for personal use and illegally striking a juvenile with police baton and the fines and penalties that occured due to the officers conduct if guilty. Some accounts were proved sustained and not sustain.

record.DocumentTitle: May Report On Administration of Internal Discipline
record.Description: Report describes various officers conduct on and off duty such as failing to process emergency call in timely manner, failed to report on duty numerous times, attempted to influence a criminal investigation by another law enforcment agency and removed merchandise from store without paying for it. There were fines and penalties that occured due to the officers conduct if guilty. Some accounts were proved sustained and not sustained.

record.DocumentTitle: April Report On Administration Of Internal Discipline
record.Description: Report describes various officers conduct on and off duty such as accepting payment for off-duty work performed while off duty which resulted in $4,000 in penelties, caused damage to City vehicle windshield by throwing radio microphone at dashboard; intentionally broke windshield from outside to conceal prior demage and offense with a red chek next to it is officer improperly obtained and copied exams for explorer police recruits.There were fines and penalties that occured due to officers conduct if guilty. Some accounts were proved sustained and not sustained.

record.DocumentTitle: March Report On Administration Of Internal Discipline
record.Description: Report describes various officers conduct on and off duty such as failing to properly secure department handgun resulting in property loss and while on duty consumed alcoholic beverages in public view. There were fines and penalities that occured if found guilty. Some accounts were proved sustained and not sustained.

record.DocumentTitle: February Report On Administration Of Internal Discipline
record.Description: Report describes various officers conduct on and off duty such as failed to maintain control of department "Rover" resulting in its loss, submitted overtime reports requesting compensation for on-call court to which he was not entitled and failed to appear in court after being subpoenaed. There were fines and penalties that occured if found guilty. Some accounts were proved sustained and not sustained.

record.DocumentTitle: January Report On Administration Of Internal Discipline
record.Description: Report describes various officers conduct on and off duty such as improperly solicitating a female officer to commit act of prostitution and gave false statements to supervisor. Failure to book evidenciary value at scene of burglary. Failed to take supervisory action make timely action after being made aware of the dtentions of four subordinates by another law enforcement agency. Off duty detective masturbated in a public telephone booth and exposed private parts while standing in a public telephone booth, resulting in 7-day suspention.Consumed alcoholic beverages while on duty. There were fines and penalties that occured if found guilty. Some accounts were found sustained and not sustained.

record.DocumentTitle: December Report On Administration Of Internal Discipline
record.Description: Report describes various officers conduct on and off duty such as unlawfully discharging firearm in Tucson, Arizona which resulted in several officers being reprimanded. Improperly completed impound sheets at Official Police Garage. Became involved in an altercationwhile off duty and directed imprpoer comments to citizen. There were fines and penalties that occured if found guilty. Some accounts were found sustained and not sustained.

record.DocumentTitle: Office Memo from Assitant Chief of OSS Robert L. Vernon to Lt. Riley
record.Description: Regarding incidents of officer's gathering off-duty to drink in parking lots and department facilities. Leads to disorderly conduct, drunk driving, improper use of firearms, vandalism and sex-related activities. Memo suggests that as no amount of memos and meetings forbidding the practice have been effective, an ethics class must be implimented, particularly for Officer's in the Hollywood Area.

record.DocumentTitle: LAPD Letter to Consul General of Malawi from Chief Gates
record.Description: Response thanking consul general Brody for suggesting that LAPD investigate "Extra Margin" Emergency Escape Masks for fire emergencies, along w/ Brody's original message

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Councilman Howard Finn
record.Description: Gates giving councilman a brief history & list of the awards given out for LAPD, after Councilman Finn's request to initiate award for "Commendable Restraint" when officers avoid use of excessive force. Gates essentially states this to inform & note that LAPD gives out awards but somehow others are not taking note

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Zev Yaroslavsky, Chairman of Police, Fire, & Public Safety Committee
record.Description: response to request for investigation of procedures to acquire police reports. Explaining that delay of 6-8 weeks in response to police reports requests is a result of cut downs on personnel and needed equipment

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Clyde A. Bragdon, Jr.
record.Description: Response in thanks to commendatory letter the fire chief wrote about an outstanding deed an officer did when saving injured woman from burning house

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Mr. David D. Solomon
record.Description: Letter thanking Mr. Solomon for his generous donation of bread to supplement "prisoner feeding", offera to alwyas donate day-old bakery items but they decline politely

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to General Manager Driscoll of Personnel Department
record.Description: Informing general manager that state law prohibits his request of gaining access to specific inquiries through CRT and printer located in City Hall. Explaining parameters established for who gets access to criminal offender records and for what purpose

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to C. J. Lenander w/ attached memo
record.Description: Response to attached letter from C.J. Lenander offering to volunteer as technical consultatnt to help improve LAPD processes after daughter's homicide case was not difinitve. More specifically offering help for the ECCCS/ROVER project for the LAPD. Gates responds with offering Lenander a position as specialist reserve officer

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Honolulu Chief of Police, Chief Keala
record.Description: Response to Chief Keala's original letter requesting permission for Major to visit. Gates states it would be a pleasure to host Major Uemura's visit to LAPD's Police Academy, to meet with Captain Hays

record.DocumentTitle: Letter
record.Description: Gates responds to Burden's inquiry of how LAPD runs their entry level examiniations for police officers

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Councilman Howard Finn
record.Description: Gates provides info requested by Finn regarding an evaluation request of the Talon, an electrical stimulation glove designed for use as a nonlethal control device used to subdue suspects

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Natchez, Miss Chief of Police, Chief Fairly
record.Description: Gates providing info requested by Chief Fairly, regarding inquiry of LAPD male and female officer uniforms specifications

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Kokomo, IN Chief of Police, Chief Fain
record.Description: Gates explains ongoing program for testing nonlethal weapons including usage of taser gun

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to City Admin Officer Comrie
record.Description: Re: review of proposed vacation accrual & salary step changes

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Carolyn Smith
record.Description: response to complaint apologizing on behalf of personnel for not handling correspeondence for crime investigation successfully

record.DocumentTitle: Memo from Captain Mitchell, CO of Jail Division to Chief Gates, Chief Vernon, Chief Lanzarone

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Commissioner Hung of National Bureau of Criminal Investigation, Taiwan, Republic of China
record.Description: Gates explains ongoing program for testing nonlethal weapons including usage of taser gun, along with explanations of any failed guns

record.DocumentTitle: Office Memo from Assitant Chief of OSS Robert L. Vernon to Lt. Riley
record.Description: Regarding incidents of officer's gathering off-duty to drink in parking lots and department facilities. Leads to disorderly conduct, drunk driving, improper use of firearms, vandalism and sex-related activities. Memo suggests that as no amount of memos and meetings forbidding the practice have been effective, an ethics class must be implimented, particularly for Officer's in the Hollywood Area.

record.DocumentTitle: LAPD Letter to Consul General of Malawi from Chief Gates
record.Description: Response thanking consul general Brody for suggesting that LAPD investigate "Extra Margin" Emergency Escape Masks for fire emergencies, along w/ Brody's original message

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Councilman Howard Finn
record.Description: Gates giving councilman a brief history & list of the awards given out for LAPD, after Councilman Finn's request to initiate award for "Commendable Restraint" when officers avoid use of excessive force. Gates essentially states this to inform & note that LAPD gives out awards but somehow others are not taking note

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Zev Yaroslavsky, Chairman of Police, Fire, & Public Safety Committee
record.Description: response to request for investigation of procedures to acquire police reports. Explaining that delay of 6-8 weeks in response to police reports requests is a result of cut downs on personnel and needed equipment

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Clyde A. Bragdon, Jr.
record.Description: Response in thanks to commendatory letter the fire chief wrote about an outstanding deed an officer did when saving injured woman from burning house

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Mr. David D. Solomon
record.Description: Letter thanking Mr. Solomon for his generous donation of bread to supplement "prisoner feeding", offera to alwyas donate day-old bakery items but they decline politely

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to General Manager Driscoll of Personnel Department
record.Description: Informing general manager that state law prohibits his request of gaining access to specific inquiries through CRT and printer located in City Hall. Explaining parameters established for who gets access to criminal offender records and for what purpose

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to C. J. Lenander w/ attached memo
record.Description: Response to attached letter from C.J. Lenander offering to volunteer as technical consultatnt to help improve LAPD processes after daughter's homicide case was not difinitve. More specifically offering help for the ECCCS/ROVER project for the LAPD. Gates responds with offering Lenander a position as specialist reserve officer

record.DocumentTitle: Letter from Chief Gates to Honolulu Chief of Police, Chief Keala
record.Description: Response to Chief Keala's original letter requesting permission for Major to visit. Gates states it would be a pleasure to host Major Uemura's visit to LAPD's Police Academy, to meet with Captain Hays

record.Description: Gates responds to Burden's inquiry of how LAPD runs their entry level examiniations for police officers

record.Description: Gates explains ongoing program for testing nonlethal weapons including usage of taser gun
